summary: Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) and S&P 500 (^GSPC) close at their highest levels since February . Nasdaq 100 (NQ=F), which tracks many of the market’s most influential tech names, notched a fresh closing high . Rally came as optimism grew around a fragile US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Iran, raising hopes for a more lasting end to regional hostilities .  Relief rally builds amid hopes for a lasting end to the 12-day-old Middle East conflict . On Monday, US stocks rose as Iran's response to US attacks signaled deescalating tensions . On Tuesday, President Trump said that thepause in hostilities had begun . But hours later, Israel accused Iran of breaching the ceasefire .  FedEx shares fell roughly 5% in after-hours trading . The company issued a weaker-than-expected earnings forecast for the current quarter . Fed Chair Powell reiterated his stance that the central bank can afford to hold interest rates steady .  Nasdaq 100 hit a new all-time high, with Nasdaq Composite closing at 1.4% . S&P 500, Nasdaq 500 close at their highest levels since February, nearing record highs . FedEx reported stronger-than-expected results for its fiscal fourth quarter .  Bitcoin (BTC-USD) jumped nearly 3% to trade around $105,900 on Tuesday . Bitcoin miners also jumped, with Riot Platforms (RIOT) gaining 6.7% and MARA Holdings (MARA) adding 4.6% . Oil futures extended declines to drop 6% on Tuesday after President Trump furiously sought to maintain an increasingly fragile ceasefire between Israel and Iran .  Nvidia shares jumped over 2% Tuesday to $147.40, putting the stock on track to end the trading session at its highest level since its record close in January . Nvidia has risen more than 12% in the past month alone, roughly double the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite’s 6.3% gain . Chip stocks rallied across the board Tuesday .  Nasdaq 100 set to hit a fresh record close Tuesday, trading above 22,400 . Uber and Waymo have partnered to offer robotaxi rides in Phoenix and Austin . Waymo last week applied for a permit to test its self-driving cabs in New York City .  Nvidia (NVDA) and Amazon (AMZN) led the "Magnificent Seven" Big Tech stocks higher midday Tuesday . Nvidia shares jumped 1.8%, while Amazon rose 2.3% . Microsoft (MSFT) rose about 1%, and Apple (AAPL) traded roughly flat .  Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Capitol Hill: "We're focused on one thing. That’s it. Anything else is kind of a distraction" Powell didn't reference any specific criticism or comments but underscored his approach to the job .  Jerome Powell: "I care about doing the job for the American people" He says the Fed is "well-positioned to wait to learn more about the likely course of the economy before considering any adjustments to our policy stance" Powell also spoke to broader economic challenges facing the Fed .  Consumer confidence retreated in June after a large increase seen the month prior amid President Trump's various tariff delays . Powell: "It's too early to know what any economic implications might be. Like everyone else, we are, of course, watching the situation"  The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) popped about 0.6%, or roughly 275 points, while the S&P 500 (^GSPC) added 0.7% . The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) led the advance, gaining about 1% . Hims & Hers Health stock rose modestly in premarket trading Tuesday after plummeting nearly 35% on Monday .  Waymo announced on Tuesday it is rolling out itsrobotaxi service in Atlanta as part of its partnership with Uber . Tesla stock extended gains in premarket trading on Tuesday after launching its robotaxi . Waymo now offers self-driving rides in Los Angeles, Austin, Phoenix, and San Francisco .  Tesla shares were up 2% Tuesday morning on the Waymo. service in Austin, Texas, over the weekend . Ride-hailing companies Uber and Lyft also gained premarket . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has started selling Nvidia stock under a plan that allows the CEO to shed up to $835 million worth of shares .  The chipmaker's shares were up slightly in premarket trading, amid a broader rally stoked by hopes for a break in Mideast hostilities . Read more here .  Trump Media and Technology Group (DJT) stock rose over 3% in premarket trading . Tesla (TSLA) stock was up 2% before the bell on Tuesday . Wolfspeed (WOLF) stock rebounded on Tuesday and rose by 6% . United Airlines (UAL) shares rose 3% after Jefferies increased its price target on UAL from $80 to $100 .  CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery . Please submit your best shots of life in the gallery for next week's gallery . Visit http://www.dailymailonline.com/Travel next week for a new gallery of snapshots .

Warren Buffett’s value-driven investment strategy has long been admired by both Wall Street professionals and everyday investors . Buffett's disciplined approach has consistently outperformed the market, even as economic cycles shift and market sentiment wavers . VistaShares Target 15 Berkshire Select Income ETF (OMAH) launched in March 2025 .  VistaShares Target 15 Berkshire Select Income ETF gives investors a straightforward way to follow Warren Buffett’s well-known investing style . The latest payout was $0.24 per share, which works out to an annual yield of 3.83% . OMAH maintains this by putting money into the 20 biggest stocks in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio .  OMAH is down 3.2% over the last three months and 1.8% in the past month . The fund's portfolio includes 73 holdings, each chosen to match Buffett’s approach . Apple (AAPL) at 10.5%, Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.B) at 9.76%, American Express (AXP) at 8.74% .  The fund’s launch in March 2025 lined up well with a stretch when options-based income strategies started to shine . OMAH's approach fits well with what people want today — and could help it do even better in the near future . The S&P 500 has seen big swings this year, from a high of $6,147 in February to $7,000 in February .  OMAH’s options strategy is built for this kind of market, letting the fund earn extra income from selling covered calls . U.S. derivative income funds brought in over $6 billion in May, the biggest monthly increase ever .  OMAH is a modern solution that makes classic value investing feel brand new . For investors who want to “invest like Buffett’s” but also crave monthly cash flow .

Bank of America (BofA) adjustedits price target for Qualcomm from $245 to $200 . Apple is working on in-house modems, which means lower sales for Qualcomm . Apple's contribution to Qualcomm’s handset revenues to plummet to 6% in FY2027 . Despite the lowered target, BofA analysts believe the stock is still a Buy .  Qualcomm Incorporated (NASDAQ:QCOM) is a global semiconductor and wireless technology company . It designs and supplies chips and system software for smartphones, automotive systems, Internet of Things (IoT) devices, and edge computing . The company serves major device makers like Samsung and Apple .

Facebook parent Meta is reportedly in talks to buy Safe Superintelligence CEO Daniel Gross and former Github CEO Nat Friedman for its planned superintelligence lab . The move comes after Meta invested $14.3 billion in AI startup Scale AI and hired its CEO and co-founder Alexandr Wang .  Meta delayed the debut of its massive Llama 4 Behemoth AI model until later this fall . Forrester analyst Mike Proulx: “Meta is doing this because they want to win the AI race, period”  Meta imposes some restrictions on how users can take advantage of its models . The company requires firms to request a license from Meta if their product has more than 700 million monthly active users . Company primarily uses its AI to power its advertising and content recommendation services .  Meta is leaning on its AI models to provide intelligence for its hardware products including its Ray-Ban Meta smartglasses and other future AI-powered devices . Apple is also reportedly looking into bagging its own AI company .  For Meta, it will all come down to whether it can woo the right people from the right AI firms to join its AI push and catapult the company into the pole position in the AI race . Samsung is also reportedly looking to add Perplexity to its devices .

AAPL stands to benefit significantly from Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend .

Apple released the second developer beta of iOS 26 on June 24 . The initial iOS 26 developer beta, announced earlier this month at WWDC 2025, featured a highly translucent design that made the Control Center appear cluttered and difficult to read due to the visibility of underlying Home Screen content . In the second beta, Apple has made the control Center much more opaque by adjusting the background blur .  A public beta version of iOS 26 is anticipated to launch next month for users who wish to test the new features before the official release . Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide .

China hasramped up security around its rare-earth sector, ordering companies to catalog technical staff and even hand over passports . Beijing's use of export controls as a geopolitical lever . Rare earth elements power everything from electric vehicle motors and consumer electronics .  Beijing's tighter reins could drive supply shortages, higher prices and accelerated efforts to develop alternative materials or recycling capabilities . Western automakers like Tesla and tech giants like Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) race to source rare earths from Australia, India and the U.S.

Apple's stock saw a 2.58% rise last month . The broader market trends indicate a 1.9% increase over the past week alone . Product innovations, such as enhancements in software and privacy measures, likely provided balance against legal pressures .  Apple's stock enjoyed a 2.58% rise last month, indicating resilience amidst headwinds . Over a longer span of five years, Apple delivered a total shareholder return of 126.37%, showcasing its strong performance despite challenges . Over the past year, Apple's share performance underperformed the US market's 12.2% return .  Apple's future performance will largely depend on its ability to navigate both its legal environment and market dynamics . US$232.17, suggests room for appreciation, assuming the company successfully addresses these challenges while capitalizing on growth opportunities . The Magnificent 7 is comprised of Alphabet (GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Meta (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Nvidia (NVDA) and Tesla (TSLA) These are some of the most recognizable names in technology but also among the most powerful drivers of the S&P 500 .  June 2015 price (accounting for stock splits):$21.70 Closing price on June 16, 2025:$216.10 10-year return:895.9% Current value of $10,000 investment:$99,590 Amazon's dominant position in online retail has made it a winning bet on Wall Street .  The Facebook, WhatsApp and Instagram parent shifted much of its focus to building the metaverse a few years ago . Microsoft's recent buzz comes from its investment in OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT . Meta has since refocused on its core social medial businesses .  Tesla has positioned itself as a tech firm even though its main business is making electric vehicles . Nvidia has seen its share price rise more than 28,000% over the past decade . Tesla has faced headwinds this yeardue to Musk's work with the Department of Government Efficiency .  Five of the Magnificent 7 stocks have split at least once since 2015, so the prices listed for June 2015 have been adjusted based on later stock splits . They are not reflective of the actual price you would have paid then .

U.S. exchange operators in talks with SEC on easing regulatory burdens for public companies . Reforms range from reducing the quantum of disclosures and costs of going public to making it harder for minority investors to agitate, sources say .  Nasdaq President Nelson Griggs said the exchange operator has discussed making public markets more attractive with regulators in Washington . "We need to make the public markets attractive because that is really how you democratize access to these companies," he said .  The SEC said it is looking to ease rules that can impede capital formation . The SEC did not comment on specific discussions it has held with exchanges and other stakeholders . Relaxing rules around disclosure requirements often come at the expense of investors .  The discussions zero in on regulations that make it harder for companies to list and then stay public . One area in focus is an overhaul of current proxy processes, which involves information that companies have to provide shareholders to allow them to vote on various matters . Reform would make it easier for activist shareholders with small stakes to launch proxy contests .  Rollbacks would also make it easier for public companies to raise capital by selling additional shares through follow-on offerings, sources said . SEC had cracked down on SPACs, in which a firm goes public by selling itself to a listed shell company .  Since 2000, the number of public companies listed on U.S. exchanges has declined 36% to 4,500, according to figures compiled by Nasdaq . A typical typical IPO prospectus is 47 pages, including generic language around risk factors .  Some companies have chosen to stay away from IPOs to avoid what they see as onerous disclosure requirements, additional regulatory scrutiny, and the costs associated with going public . Elon Musk's SpaceX is among those who are reluctant to list, two people familiar with the matter say .

Nike's stock is 66% off its 2022 high due to declining revenue . Tariffs, plunging consumer sentiment, and some anti-American sentiment regarding products internationally are thorns in Nike's side right now . When companies go through rough patches, there are often opportunities for investors .  Nike is profitable, cash flow positive, and on sound financial footing, paying a quality dividendyielding2.6%. The time to buy this beaten-down stock could be now . Nike faces several challenges after some recent missteps by the company .  The consensus is that Nike vastly underestimated the value of retail shops . China is a key market in which the company aims to expand its sales . Despite the challenges, Nike is far from a distressed company .  Profits are down year-over-year, but Nike is still operating well in the black . Cash flow from operations was also positive at $3.2 billion . Nike paid investors $1.7 billion in dividends, repurchased $2.8 billion of its common stock, and ended the quarter with $8.6 billion in cash . Nike's price-to-earnings ratio is 50% off recent historical averages .  Nike will report Q4 fiscal 2025 earnings on June 26 . It is wise for interested investors to keep some cash on the sidelines to take advantage of a dip in the stock price . Nike's return to growth won't be easy, and may not be swift . Apple iPhones are used by more than 1 billion customers around the world . Sales of iPhones have been stagnant and growth has been virtually non existent in recent years . The company's vast resources give Apple many of options for diversifying and growing its business .  Apple has delayed the rollout of some AI features for its iPhones, specifically to do with its Siri assistant . The danger is that by the time Apple releases all of its AI features, there could be new ones available on rival devices . Apple has a large user base and there are around 1.4 billion iPhone users in the world .  Apple may be falling behind in AI, but that doesn't mean the business is doomed . Even at its peak, BlackBerry was nowhere near the financial strength that Apple is at today . Apple reported a staggering $93.7 billion in profit during its most recent fiscal year, with its revenue topping $391 billion .  Apple is no BlackBerry, and it's not in danger of going down a similar path anytime soon . If iPhones fall too far behind the competition, many consumers may eventually become frustrated enough . Apple's brand remains strong and while a delayed AI rollout won't cripple the business, the company does need to do a better job of innovating .  At more than 31 times its trailing earning, the stock is still looking a bit expensive given the challenges ahead and its recent performance . At such a valuation, there isn't enough margin of safety for me to consider buying the stock . I'd suggest keeping the stock on a watch list for now . TapIn, the award-winning Gen Z-focused creative agency, is joining Human Magic . The move strengthens Human Magic’s creative and cultural reach for global clients . TapIn's approach is powered by a majority Gen Z team and a belief in deploying employer brands .  Milimo Banji, CEO and Founder of TapIn, joined by Mark Hardwicke, Human Magic . TapIn is now backed by a partner that shares its values and has the global stage to help us do it, says Banji .  Human Magic is a global employer brand agency that believes the magic of business starts with humans . With two decades of experience, the agency partners with ambitious brands including Nike, Apple, Microsoft, VISA, LinkedIn, and AstraZeneca .  Human Magic is partnering with IHG to reshape how employer brands engage the next generation of talent . Human Magic will be joined by HR and HR experts in the UK and Australia . The Human Magic team is working with HR to develop a global network of talent agencies .

The year 2025, so far, hasn’t been kind to Apple (AAPL) shareholders . The stock is trading below the $200 mark, about 25% off its all-time highs . This is a sharp contrast to the 22% total annualized returns Apple has delivered to shareholders over the past decade .  Apple's recent performance reflects that markets view the company’s thesis as one of the most fragile, mainly due to growing concerns around the ongoing trade war . The possibility of new tariffs on imported products resurfaced after the U.S. president threatened to impose a 25%tariff on iPhones manufactured outside the US . Growth estimates are likely to be revised downward for the coming quarters—and possibly even years .  Approximately 75% of Apple’s revenue still comes from hardware, which is more susceptible to tariff risks . Apple responded quickly by expanding its production outside of China, significantly reducing its reliance on the country . Apple's services segment accounts for around 40% of operating profit .  Currently, Apple trades at 27.3x forward earnings, which is significantly below the 36x peak reached in January . Apple shouldn’t be trading at cheap multiples and probably never will, simply because it’s a company with a historically low risk of underperformance . Apple has faced similar headwinds not long ago and managed to navigate them successfully .  The old saying “buy low, sell high” is somewhat of a misnomer, mainly because no one actually knows where “low” and “high” truly are . Great stocks tend to perform better on a risk-adjusted basis when they’re trending higher .  High-quality stocks are in a clear uptrend when they trade above long-term moving averages like the 200-day moving average . AAPL is right now: stuck in a weak momentum phase . The consensus among AAPL analysts remains mostly bullish, with 16 of 29 experts covering the stock .  Apple bulls may be tempted to jump in on the “buy the dip” opportunity as valuations fall from their peaks . No one ever truly knows how low Apple’s valuation can go . Historically, high-quality stocks tend to behave better when they’re near a peak rather than stuck in the middle of corrections .

U.S. exchange operators in talks with SEC on easing regulatory burdens for public companies . Reforms range from reducing the quantum of disclosures and costs of going public to making it harder for minority investors to agitate, sources say .  Nasdaq President Nelson Griggs said the exchange operator has discussed making public markets more attractive with regulators in Washington . "We need to make the public markets attractive because that is really how you democratize access to these companies," he said .  The SEC said it is looking to ease rules that can impede capital formation . The SEC did not comment on specific discussions it has held with exchanges and other stakeholders . Relaxing rules around disclosure requirements often come at the expense of investors .  The discussions zero in on regulations that make it harder for companies to list and then stay public . One area in focus is an overhaul of current proxy processes, which involves information that companies have to provide shareholders to allow them to vote on various matters . Reform would make it easier for activist shareholders with small stakes to launch proxy contests .  Rollbacks would also make it easier for public companies to raise capital by selling additional shares through follow-on offerings, sources said . SEC had cracked down on SPACs, in which a firm goes public by selling itself to a listed shell company .  Since 2000, the number of public companies listed on U.S. exchanges has declined 36% to 4,500, according to figures compiled by Nasdaq . A typical typical IPO prospectus is 47 pages, including generic language around risk factors .  Some companies have chosen to stay away from IPOs to avoid what they see as onerous disclosure requirements, additional regulatory scrutiny, and the costs associated with going public . Elon Musk's SpaceX is among those who are reluctant to list, two people familiar with the matter say .

Apple iPhones are used by more than 1 billion customers around the world . Sales of iPhones have been stagnant and growth has been virtually non existent in recent years . The company's vast resources give Apple many of options for diversifying and growing its business .  Apple has delayed the rollout of some AI features for its iPhones, specifically to do with its Siri assistant . The danger is that by the time Apple releases all of its AI features, there could be new ones available on rival devices . Apple has a large user base and there are around 1.4 billion iPhone users in the world .  Apple may be falling behind in AI, but that doesn't mean the business is doomed . Even at its peak, BlackBerry was nowhere near the financial strength that Apple is at today . Apple reported a staggering $93.7 billion in profit during its most recent fiscal year, with its revenue topping $391 billion .  Apple is no BlackBerry, and it's not in danger of going down a similar path anytime soon . If iPhones fall too far behind the competition, many consumers may eventually become frustrated enough . Apple's brand remains strong and while a delayed AI rollout won't cripple the business, the company does need to do a better job of innovating .  At more than 31 times its trailing earning, the stock is still looking a bit expensive given the challenges ahead and its recent performance . At such a valuation, there isn't enough margin of safety for me to consider buying the stock . I'd suggest keeping the stock on a watch list for now . Use biometrics for banking and sensitive apps that support them, to block access . Back up your tablet using iCloud on an iPad, Google Drive on an Android tablet or Amazon’s Backup and Restore feature on a Fire tablet .

Apple is facing pushback from the automotive industry over its CarPlay Ultra, three years after the tech giant unveiled a software system . The tech giant's CarPlay system was unveiled in 2011 and has been in use for three years .

The year 2025, so far, hasn’t been kind to Apple (AAPL) shareholders . The stock is trading below the $200 mark, about 25% off its all-time highs . This is a sharp contrast to the 22% total annualized returns Apple has delivered to shareholders over the past decade .  Apple's recent performance reflects that markets view the company’s thesis as one of the most fragile, mainly due to growing concerns around the ongoing trade war . The possibility of new tariffs on imported products resurfaced after the U.S. president threatened to impose a 25%tariff on iPhones manufactured outside the US . Growth estimates are likely to be revised downward for the coming quarters—and possibly even years .  Approximately 75% of Apple’s revenue still comes from hardware, which is more susceptible to tariff risks . Apple responded quickly by expanding its production outside of China, significantly reducing its reliance on the country . Apple's services segment accounts for around 40% of operating profit .  Currently, Apple trades at 27.3x forward earnings, which is significantly below the 36x peak reached in January . Apple shouldn’t be trading at cheap multiples and probably never will, simply because it’s a company with a historically low risk of underperformance . Apple has faced similar headwinds not long ago and managed to navigate them successfully .  The old saying “buy low, sell high” is somewhat of a misnomer, mainly because no one actually knows where “low” and “high” truly are . Great stocks tend to perform better on a risk-adjusted basis when they’re trending higher .  High-quality stocks are in a clear uptrend when they trade above long-term moving averages like the 200-day moving average . AAPL is right now: stuck in a weak momentum phase . The consensus among AAPL analysts remains mostly bullish, with 16 of 29 experts covering the stock .  Apple bulls may be tempted to jump in on the “buy the dip” opportunity as valuations fall from their peaks . No one ever truly knows how low Apple’s valuation can go . Historically, high-quality stocks tend to behave better when they’re near a peak rather than stuck in the middle of corrections .
